document_data.caption: A map of Hordelands tribal territories, showing that of the Zamogedi.
document_data.name: Zamogedi
document_data.mainbody: The '''Zamogedi''' were a tribe of nomadic [[human]]s living in the [[Hordelands]].{{Cite dragon/349/The Horde: Barbarians of the Endless Waste|48}} They were among the tribes mistakenly called "[[Tuigan]]" by outsiders following the [[Horde Wars]].
document_data.Territory: The Zamogedi lived in the eastern Hordelands near [[Shou Lung]], near the [[Tuigan]] tribe. Their lands also bordered those of the [[Gur]]s, the [[Fankiang]], and the [[Quirish]].
document_data.Society:
They spoke [[Zamogedi language|their own language]].

They were a highly warlike tribe and were known to disrespect the [[Elf|elves]] of the [[Pleasant Valley Gateway Oasis]] and often raided them.
document_data.History:
The Zamogedi shared a common ancestor with the Quirish peoples.

Before the rise of the Tuigan to dominance, the Zamogedi held much territory in the northern steppes. During this time, there were many marriages between the the Zamogedi and the Naican, solidifying the friendship between these two people groups.
